action.action-desc: Ms. Titus (for herself and Mr. Heck of Nevada) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To require the Nuclear Regulatory Commission to obtain the consent of affected State and local governments before authorizing the construction of a nuclear waste repository.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Nuclear Waste Informed Consent Act.

In this Act, the terms affected Indian tribe, Commission, high-level radioactive waste, repository, and spent nuclear fuel have the meanings given the terms in section 2 of the Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982 (42 U.S.C. 10101).

subsection.text: The Commission may not authorize construction of a repository unless the Secretary has entered into an agreement to host the repository with—

paragraph.text: the Governor of the State in which the repository is proposed to be located;
each affected unit of local government;

any unit of general local government contiguous to the affected unit of local government if spent nuclear fuel or high-level radioactive waste will be transported through that unit of general local government for disposal at the repository; and

subsection.text: Any agreement to host a repository under this Act—

paragraph.text: shall be in writing and signed by all parties;
shall be binding on the parties; and
shall not be amended or revoked except by mutual agreement of the parties.

section.text: This Act applies to any application submitted to the Commission for construction authorization for a repository that—

paragraph.text: exists as of the date of enactment of this Act; or
is submitted on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
